title: (x) Rick's Famous Custard - Cool Air Conditioner, TF Saginaw {Mike Y, Ignacio}
content:
I’m sure these are digital, the bottom one is consistent. Anyone know either of them?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [custard.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/typophile.com/files/custard.jpg) | 49 KB |
author: evan

comments.content:
Kind of similar to [Permanent Waves](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/fontdiner.com/menu_doggie.html), but there’s also another scripty-joined-retro-diner-car-type font like that that I can’t remember the name of.

—-

The (badly) connected script at the bottom is Cool Air Conditioner a free font at [Font Diner](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/www.fontdiner.com/main.html). The other script may be hand-drawn, but check out the other Font Diner selections — maybe that’s where the designer did his/her shopping.

- Mike Yanega
I was about to suggest Font Diner too.
air conditioner looks right, thanks. The flowing script looks so familiar to me.

Ricks looks like a monoline version of Murry Hill or Phyllis to me, but there are other fonts with a very simalar look, my favorite being [Bounce Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/letterheadfonts.com/contributors/charlesborges/bouncescript.shtml) from [Letterhead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Letterhead%20Fonts).  
Some others:  
 [Freehand 591](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/freehand-591/)  
 [Wendy](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letterperfect/wendy/)
Rick’s is [TF Saginaw](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/www.treacyfaces.com/oneliner21.html) Heavy or Extrabold, hard to say.

I knew it was from Font Diner I just forgot to check the free fonts page…I had just [used](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/www.nickfruhling.com/personal/2006/03/canstruction-team-shirt.html) the very similar [Rocket Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20060523005129/http:/fontdiner.com/vendrocket.gif) that very day.

—-
